The SDK for Android 4.0.1 (Ice Cream Sandwich), based on Linux kernel 3.0.1, was publicly released on October 19, 2011.
Google's Gabe Cohen stated that Android 4.0 was 'theoretically compatible' with any Android 2.3.x device in production at that time.
The source code for Android 4.0 became available on November 14, 2011.
Ice Cream Sandwich was the last version to officially support Adobe Systems' Flash player.
